sentence.Network_en: She is expected to be subservient to her uncle.
sentence.Network_cn: 她被要求对叔叔恭敬顺从。

sentence.Network_en: The woman's needs are seen as subservient to the group interest.
sentence.Network_cn: 妇女的需求被认为要服从团体的利益。

sentence.Network_en: The press was accused of being subservient to the government.
sentence.Network_cn: 有人指责新闻界一味迎合政府的旨意。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 马字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 马屁〖 flattery〗 马屁精〖 subservient;flatterer;flunkey;applepolisher〗 马前卒〖 pawn〗.
新概念第四册单词总汇[旺旺英语论坛] ... out-patient 门珍病人 subservient 屈从的 violent 强烈的.
字典中巽字的解释 ... (1) 八卦之一。代表风[ wind;one of the eight diagrams of bagua] (1) 卑顺;怯懦[ subservient] ◎ 巽 xùn.
英语词汇新译 S_翻译家(Fanyijia.com) ... subserviency 有用 subservient 有帮助的 subset 子集.

list.abs: They pretend a certain subservience ,, 他们假装在伺候人,
He ' s totally subservient to his boss ., 他对上司俯首帖耳.
the open admiration of young men in ancient greece was part of a culture of manliness where women played a subservient role .古希腊对年轻男性的公开仰慕是男子汉文化的一部分在这种文化中，女性居于从属地位。
Innumerable subservient heroes were appealed to compete for it ., 无数拜倒石榴的英雄都为了它被吸引来竞争.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from Latin subservient- 'subjecting to, complying with', from the verb subservire (see subserve)

entry.def: If you are subservient, you do whatever someone wants you to do.

example.ex: She is expected to be subservient to her uncle.
example.tran: 她被要求对叔叔恭敬顺从。

entry.def: If you treat one thing as subservient to another, you treat it as less important than the other thing.

example.ex: The woman's needs are seen as subservient to the group interest.
example.tran: 妇女的需求被认为要服从团体的利益。

sentences.sentence: "editors and journalists who express opinions in print that are opposed to the interests of the rich are dismissed and replaced by subservient ones"-G. B. Shaw

means.word_mean: 2. abjectly submissive; characteristic of a slave or servant;

sentences.sentence: "slavish devotion to her job ruled her life"
"a slavish yes-man to the party bosses"- S.H.Adams

auth_sentence.content: His efforts were seconded by a somewhat subservient parliament.
auth_sentence.res_content: His efforts were seconded by a somewhat subservient parliament.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His efforts were seconded by a somewhat subservient parliament.

auth_sentence.content: Biological evolution is subservient to a pleasure principle.
auth_sentence.res_content: Biological evolution is subservient to a pleasure principle.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Biological evolution is subservient to a pleasure principle.

auth_sentence.content: Even this envoy was subservient to the Coalition.
auth_sentence.res_content: Even this envoy was subservient to the Coalition.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Even this envoy was subservient to the Coalition.

means.word_mean: 毕恭毕敬的;低声下气的,恭顺的
